result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake L. Herbst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Posts or Publishes Private Representation w/out Consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(3m)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid within 60 days; alternate 8 days jail.

With Huber.
Transfer allowed to Dodge and Fond du Lac County.
Report by 5/18/16 by 6pm.

NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Posts or Publishes Private Representation w/out Consent
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake L. Herbst

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Permitting Defendant Two Hour Visit with Father at Hospice Care on June 9, 2016.    Defendant to leave work at 6:00 p.m. travel to the Hospice Facility and return to Huber no later than 8:30 p.m.

dated 6/9/16 filed by Attorney LaVoy requesting 2-hour leave for defendant to visit father in hospice, with proposed order.

Approved by Judge Ramirez.

Defendant Blake L. Herbst in court with Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Lavoy makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following: 

COUNT #1:  

90  DAYS HUBER  - Defendant to report on 5/18/16 by 6:00 p.m.   **transfer allowed to Dodge and Fond du Lac County** NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING

   COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid in 60 days, alternate 8 days jail if not paid

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

NOTE:  Request for expungment is DENIED
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Blake L. Herbst in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defrense requests matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy in court.   Defendant Blake L. Herbst did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as he is still waiting for records from Carroll Unversity. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Dated 1/27/16 filed by Attorney LaVoy; letter with Subpoena, Certificate of Appearance and Release Authorization for records and disciplinary findings.

Approved by Judge Maxwell 2/2/16

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to use or possess anyvideo recording equipment except as to 1 cell phone and is to not record anything on the internet.   Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/Carroll University listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Blake L. Herbst in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Attorney LaVoy with cover letter.
